Traits.Name: Invisibility in Darkness
Traits.Content: The Dover Demon can become invisible while in dim light or darkness, making it difficult to detect.

Traits.Name: Bizarre Appearance
Traits.Content: Creatures that see the Dover Demon for the first time must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of their next turn.

Traits.Name: Spellcasting
Traits.Content: The Dover Demon is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following spells prepared: At will: minor illusion, thaumaturgy; 1/day each: disguise self, fear.

Actions.Name: Dreadful Grasp
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +5 to hit, dealing 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of its next turn. While frightened, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

Actions.Name: Terrifying Screech
Actions.Content: The Dover Demon emits a bone-chilling screech, requiring all creatures within 30 feet to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) thunder damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. This ability can be used once per short or long rest.
